channel.title: Whats wrong with this?

item.title: Whats wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“dudeofthed, post:3, topic:86623”]The bitmaps are too big. And i see you copied my Typing Terror script with the KeyDowns. Why couldn’t you do it yourself. Anyway, i don’t care.

Good work though. I used bitmaps but it didn’t work for me in the typing terror game. That’s why i added a the KeyDown(32); instead of a bitmap for space.

Keep up the good work and try not to copy next time.[/quote]Wasn’t trying to copy, sorry, was trying to make it a little better with an auto-restarter but the bitmaps wouldn’t work as you said… lol

Read full topic

item.title: Whats wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

The bitmaps are too big. And i see you copied my Typing Terror script with the KeyDowns. Why couldn’t you do it yourself. Anyway, i don’t care.

Good work though. I used bitmaps but it didn’t work for me in the typing terror game. That’s why i added a the KeyDown(32); instead of a bitmap for space.

Keep up the good work and try not to copy next time.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @CJg CJg
item.description:
@CJg wrote:

In the findcolor(startgame1) you need more values, kinda like below.

Xs, Ys, Xe, Ye defines the box to look for the color “startgame1”

Make a box like this…

Xs                                Ys






Xe                                Ye

Move the mouse to the top right corner of where your color is located, then look in the bottom left of scar and put those two values like for example My Xs is “123:456”

So i would do “Findcolor(x, y, startgame1, 123, 456,)”

Now for the other two, move it to the lower left corner of where it should look for the color.

Lets say i get “700:1200”

i would do “Findcolor(x, y, startgame1, 123, 456, 700, 1200)”

Those arent real values, but you get the idea.

EDIT: Also, instead of doing the “var x, y” you can include SRL “{.include SRL/SRL.scar}” not 100% sure if you have to since i don’t know much about SRL.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[code]program TypingTerror;
////////////////////////////////////////////////////
// Made By: Zach (Slave Scyth) //
// Made On: Saturday, April 28, 2007 //
////////////////////////////////////////////////////
// Helped By: dudeofthed //
////////////////////////////////////////////////////
// This SCAR Script is to be used freely and is //
// not to be sold for any gain in profit. This //
// program is Copyright © 2007 TheWWRA.com //
// - All rights reserved. //
////////////////////////////////////////////////////

const Play = 11361051;
var x,y,i,x1,y1,x2,y2,restart,startgame,startgame1: integer;
procedure keys;
begin

KeyDown(GetKeyCode(‘a’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘b’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘c’));
wait(10);
keydown(getkeycode(‘d’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘e’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘f’));
wait(10);
keydown(getkeycode(‘g’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘h’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘i’));
wait(10);
keydown(getkeycode(‘j’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘k’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘l’));
wait(10);
keydown(getkeycode(‘m’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘n’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘o’));
wait(10);
keydown(getkeycode(‘p’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘q’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘r’));
wait(10);
keydown(getkeycode(‘s’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘t’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘u’));
wait(10);
keydown(getkeycode(‘v’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘w’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘x’));
wait(10);
keydown(getkeycode(‘y’));
keydown(getkeycode(‘z’));
wait(10);
keydown(32);
end;

procedure istartgame;
begin
startgame := BitmapFromString(56, 15, ‘z78DAED96E1AE83200C8’ +
‘55FA98B73E04F107DFF479AE999372558870ADBBD376872624885’ +
‘F6A32D103DDCC351D3A64D9B46EA6EEE461486301C571F7C2032A’ +
‘31989EC6CE765E4EEEF75FCC4CC5845B3913E98CE749904BCF32B’ +
‘87527ECECB7356073BD8953046F6A3BEEEA1ED6DBF651996F7C7B’ +
‘29F7BDD123930755317DB97F57659C4AC34F6358A8E476AF044D4’ +
‘8854AE080E1BF9C9F4A6711A637B997BF88EE6DC25FF9F78CA39E’ +
‘5F78B12D7E9C62E70A5A7F62967EC4B7E67F84CBDD7E009567215’ +
‘E42A765CE615C6D5E8B8C3A73EA333942599F2C40E1E3D9510512’ +
‘99E5A8D6B0A326F621454B55E5183E795D3B914CFA84E99AAB68F’ +
‘E999981323FEFD5B3C8F2AF2E7755228E7C89BACE3CAD2EAF7933’ +
‘C65A7FA164FE4A1F424276AD0939D41AB8B68E68CFE70E94EC25E’ +
‘C1932BFD59DEEA0F2BDF55A427E7D6AD1D63D3A6BF519FEBE85B9’ +
‘D’);
findbitmap(startgame,x,y);
movemouse(x,y);
clickmouse(x,y,true);
end;

procedure irestart;
begin

restart := BitmapFromString(80, 11, ‘z78DAED58ED6EC330087C2’ +
‘557696AE7A79D8FF77FA446B96CA262506C9C6D9AD64A28AAF081’ +
‘7D70260DE1911F3988360E7108216D69ABB11CE76711FCD13D36C’ +
‘E71AE890E7FFF5ADDC27FDB3FAD16B5D1B6769DD7CF3C3D08B09E’ +
‘E8DC96A52C1F9EF9966F8AE7BDDC7DF9B7ADD5B3FA82DF711B435’ +
‘8A6657A676914CE8E05E1B4FBB707C25ECEF15D9E7A74AE66380D’ +
‘7A32F85DE7177CE939534E2D3E12E694A654C32F5659BA5EE7B74’ +
‘DDFFC08BD30C13BEF17A91E28BF78D6F12DFEB598D7E9B3475DD1’ +
‘771E04D4A4D459B5FCA22368CF9EE7437A99778D479F7F35BFC7A’ +
‘E3DECBC20503D6CAA310FBFA89097DB90DC563437F8D08AF2F09B’ +
‘4B2EDFC62F76219C33D449D2FC2BD4D5AFBDF6ACE83465EABBC35’ +
‘FBA7FA54A865EA5318D3D34BC965F7AFF6236E3530ADD058DDB36’ +
‘1DD10990466C9BF1DAF8E50AA6BFBB714FCE05BA1BBD2931BE0EE’ +
‘B20C7EAC6EF514BFA7C85B7ADB3C2D954E9D2677A835FA1CF0453’ +
‘F2010B9EE9C882001ED1BF167DAECDCAC272ED5B33D5193CD7FEC’ +
‘3D01741DA97EE43FFDB91E634F1C40EFF5A048B7F5B56FFF66FDA’ +
‘27329BAA67’);
findbitmap(restart,x1,y1);
movemouse(x1,y1);
clickmouse(x1,y1,true);
end;
procedure uplaygame;
begin
if(findcolor(startgame1))then
movemouse(-104,-15);
clickmouse(-104,-15,true);
clickmouse(-127,42,true);
clickmouse(-132,82,true);
clickmouse(-137,145,true);
wait(10);
clickmouse(138,197,true);
clickmouse(-64,286,true);
end;

begin
startgame1 := 11361051;
cleardebug;
repeat
keys;
until(isfkeydown(12));
end.[/code] All help appreciated! Thanks!

Error: Line 104: [Error] (104:25): Invalid number of parameters in script C:\Documents and Settings\Owner\My Documents\SCAR Scripts\MINE\Typing_Terror.scar
